snippet: The two police stations in Aleppo that rebels claimed to have seized have become increasingly valuable military locations, analysts and activists said.
abstract: Syrian rebels claim control of at least two important police stations in central Aleppo, Syria's largest city and commercial center; rebels maintain their hold on several neighborhoods despite air assaults and shelling by government troops; both sides continue to dig in for an extended battle over the city, which contains police stations the government is transforming into increasingly valuable military centers.

byline.contributor: Dalal Mawad and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of the The New York Times from Aleppo, Syria.

lead_paragraph: The two police stations in Aleppo that rebels claimed to have seized have become increasingly valuable military locations, analysts and activists said.

headline.seo: Syrian Rebels Said to Seize Two Police Stations
headline.main: Rebels in Syria’s Largest City Said to Seize 2 Police Stations
headline.print_headline: Rebels in Syria’s Largest City Said to Seize 2 Police Stations

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
